intro: Diphasium complanatum subsp. montellii, commonly known as the Montell's flatleaf, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, flat leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a distinctive leaf morphology that aids in water retention. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
